name: May 1968 Protests
reason: Student protests against capitalism, consumerism, American imperialism and traditional institutions
outcome: General strike, economic paralysis, led to significant social reforms including wage increases and improved working conditions

name: Solidarity Movement
reason: Opposition to communist government, demanding workers' rights and independent trade unions
outcome: Led to the Round Table Talks in 1989 and partially free elections, contributing to the collapse of communism in Poland

name: Poll Tax Riots
reason: Opposition to the Community Charge (Poll Tax) introduced by Margaret Thatcher's government
outcome: The tax was eventually repealed and contributed to Thatcher's resignation

name: Seattle WTO Protests
reason: Opposition to World Trade Organization policies and globalization
outcome: WTO negotiations collapsed, raised global awareness about anti-globalization movement

name: Arab Spring - Egypt
reason: Political repression, poverty, unemployment, and corruption
outcome: President Hosni Mubarak resigned after 18 days of protests

name: Occupy Wall Street
reason: Economic inequality, corporate influence on government, and financial sector corruption
outcome: Raised awareness about wealth inequality, inspired similar movements worldwide

name: Indian Farmers' Protest
reason: Opposition to three farm laws that would deregulate agricultural markets
outcome: Government repealed the three controversial farm laws after a year of protests

name: South African Mine Workers Strike
reason: Demand for higher wages and better working conditions in the platinum mining sector
outcome: Reached a wage agreement after a five-month strike

name: French Pension Reform Protests
reason: Opposition to pension reform raising retirement age from 62 to 64
outcome: Despite massive protests, the pension reform was enacted using constitutional powers

name: UK Railway Strikes
reason: Disputes over pay, job security, and working conditions
outcome: Ongoing negotiations with some wage increases offered

name: US Auto Workers Strike
reason: Demand for higher wages, better benefits, and job security in transition to electric vehicles
outcome: Reached tentative agreements with major automakers including significant wage increases

name: Chilean Winter Protests
reason: Student-led movement demanding educational reform and equity
outcome: Government agreed to create a presidential advisory committee on education

name: Greek Anti-Austerity Protests
reason: Opposition to austerity measures imposed by EU/IMF bailout conditions
outcome: Massive social unrest; austerity continued but sparked pan-European anti-austerity movements

name: Brazilian Truckers' Strike
reason: Protest against rising diesel prices and poor road conditions
outcome: Government temporarily reduced fuel prices and offered subsidies

name: Sudanese Revolution
reason: Economic hardship, inflation, and demand for democratic transition after 30 years of dictatorship
outcome: Ousted President Omar al-Bashir; transitional government established
